chapter.title: Options Tab
chapter.para: This chapter describes Options tab of the Smooks Configuration File editor, gives short recommendations how this tab can be used during the project configuring.

figure.title: Options tab of the Smooks Configuration File editor

section.title: Smooks Configuration section
section.para: In the Smooks Configuration section of Options Tab only one element is availible:Smooks Platform Version

figure.title: Smooks Configuration section of Options tab

section.para: This parameter is not rechangable, and is set according to the vesion of the Smooks libraries that are added to the project.

section.title: Filter Settings Filter section
section.para: In Filter Settings section you can set the following global options responsible for Smooks filtering configuring:

figure.title: Filter Settings section of Options tab

section.para: This behavior can be turned off using this global configuration parameter and can be overriden on a per fragment basis by targetting a Visitor implementation at that fragment that takes ownership of the Result writer (in the case of SAX filtering), or simply modifies the DOM (in the case of DOM filtering). As an example of this, see the FreeMarkerTemplateProcessor.

row.entry:
Determines the type of processing model that will be used. Please refer to Filtering Process Selection section of the official Smooks User Guide for more information about these models:
SAX
DOM

Defines whether default serialization should be switched on. Default serialization being turned on leads to locating StreamResult/DOMResult to the Result objects provided to the Smooks.filterSource method and to serialization all the events to that Result.
